metadata.title: Convert Hertz to RPM – Frequency to Rotation Converter
metadata.description: Convert frequency from Hertz (Hz) to Revolutions Per Minute (RPM), useful for machinery specifications.

introduction: This converter transforms frequency in hertz to mechanical rotation rate in RPM.
Machinery specifications use RPM while frequency measured in Hz.
This converter uses the relationship where 1 Hz equals 60 RPM.
methodology: 1 Hz = 60 RPM. To convert Hz to RPM, multiply by 60.
Machinery speeds commonly expressed in RPM for practical understanding.
Understanding Hz to RPM conversion is essential for mechanical engineering.
This converter provides precise rotation rate conversion.

faqs.question: What does RPM mean?
faqs.answer: Revolutions Per Minute. How many full rotations per minute.

faqs.question: What's a typical motor speed?
faqs.answer: AC motors: 1,200-3,600 RPM. DC motors: variable. Fans: 800-3,000 RPM.

faqs.question: Why convert Hz to RPM?
faqs.answer: Electrical frequency (Hz) differs from mechanical output (RPM) by gear ratios.

faqs.question: What's the relationship between Hz and electrical frequency?
faqs.answer: 50 Hz electricity: ~1,500-3,000 RPM AC motor (pole dependent). 60 Hz: similar.

faqs.question: How do gears affect RPM?
faqs.answer: Gear ratio = input RPM / output RPM. 2:1 ratio halves RPM, doubles torque.

faqs.question: What's torque vs RPM?
faqs.answer: Torque: rotational force. RPM: rotation speed. Power = Torque × RPM.

faqs.question: How do I increase motor speed?
faqs.answer: Variable frequency drive changes Hz input. Direct: no simple way.

faqs.question: What's critical RPM?
faqs.answer: Resonance frequency where vibration amplifies. Must avoid during operation.

glossary.definition: Revolutions Per Minute: rotations per minute.
